subject: Simsonn Software Freezing
description_text:
Hello, I had an issue come up where randomly during my driving sessions my
pedal inputs will freeze temporarily. It doesn’t happen often but I’ve had
multiple race ending incidents because of it. It only started when I began
using the Simsonn Manager Software instead of a 3rd party such as Freejoy.
I’ll be on the brake at my braking point but it’ll still say i’m on the gas
until my pedal inputs catch up around a second later. Is there anything I
can do about this?

conversations.body_text: Hi Brenden Moennig,    Please provide your order number and pedal model, along with a screenshot of the software interface. This will help me better understand the issue and assist you in resolving it as soon as possible.

This video captures my issue perfectly. I brake at the 100 meter board but
it doesn’t register until my turn in point where my throttle input quits
freezing and the brake registers. I have pro X pedals. I cannot race
competitively until this is resolved i’m unsure what to do

On Tue, Oct 7, 2025 at 4:19 AM service@simsonn.com

Hi Brenden Moennig,  Please provide your order number. For the ProX pedals, please ensure that your PC supplies sufficient USB power. Make sure the USB cable is plugged directly into a rear USB 3.0 (blue) port, and avoid using a USB hub, to ensure stable power and communication. Also, please update your software to SIMSONN Manager version 2.1.2 and the firmware to version 2.0.5 before testing again.

I don’t have an order number as they were purchased with a seperate email
more than a year ago. I updated the firmware and software, and now my
pedals are having the same issue where they aren’t connecting at all. I’ve
tried pressing the upgrade button while plugging in the power cord and
nothing happens.

On Sun, Oct 19, 2025 at 9:08 PM service@simsonn.com

Hi Brenden Moennig,  ​Could you please install the Todesk tool now? I happen to be available and can remotely check and update your device for you. Todesk does not require registration — if you see a registration prompt, simply click the “X” in the top-right corner to close it. Once installed, please provide me with the ID and temporary code, and I will be able to assist you remotely.

Device ID: 586-849-418
password:yyu34e9

On Tue, Oct 21, 2025 at 10:31 PM service@simsonn.com
Hi Brenden Moennig,  The verification code you provided is incorrect.

the new one is 69k2z5q0

yup! thank you for the assistance outside of service hours by the way!

If I provide you with an order number from my pedal control box order will
you guys send a new one for replacement?

On Tue, Oct 21, 2025 at 11:57 PM Brenden Moennig <bdmoennig@gmail.com>
wrote:

> did it work for you?
>
> On Tue, Oct 21, 2025 at 11:56 PM service@simsonn.com

Hi Brenden Moennig,  Hello, if your product is beyond the one-year warranty period, you will need to purchase our spare parts to resolve the issue. However, please rest assured that our support service will continue to assist and follow up with you.

The order number is SSN2602. Should I make a new request ticket with all
this information or can you take care of it? The box was only purchased a
month or so ago.

On Wed, Oct 22, 2025 at 12:46 AM service@simsonn.com

Hi Brenden Moennig,    I misunderstood earlier — if you are using the latest version of the PlusX control box, please follow the steps below to update the firmware again:    Press and hold the upgrade button on the control box;    Connect the USB cable; at this point, SIMSONN Manager 2.1.2 will show that the device has entered SIMSONN Flasher Mode;    Go to Settings → Update → Manual Update Firmware → pedals → firmware → pedals-plusx.sfu;    Once the update is complete, please test the device again.    Additionally, please use a green wire to connect the control box to a metal screw on the pedal. Make sure there is no paint covering the contact point, as paint can affect conductivity.

I tried holding the upgrade button several times while pugging in the usb
to the control box and my pedals are still unresponsive. I can almost
garuntee my control box is faulty at this point. Is there anything you can
do about this or am I forced to look elsewhere?

On Wed, Oct 22, 2025 at 1:22 AM service@simsonn.com
Hi Brenden Moennig,  Are you available for a remote session now? I can guide you to enter recovery mode, and then I’ll help you perform the update.

sure thing

On Thu, Oct 23, 2025 at 5:51 AM service@simsonn.com
Hi Brenden Moennig,  I’m at work now — are you online?

I’ve removed the pedals from my rig and reinstalled my old fanatec ones.
I’ve simply grown impatient of the constant issues and bugs and have
decided to look elsewhere. I appreciate your help in the matter. Have a
good night.

On Thu, Oct 23, 2025 at 8:31 PM service@simsonn.com

Hi Brenden Moennig,    I haven’t received the pedal and control box photos from you yet. Earlier, you mentioned using FreeJoy, which appears to be a Pro Plus; then you said it was a ProX, and later mentioned that you purchased PlusX pedals.  At the moment, I’m unable to confirm your exact model, so the solution I provided earlier may not be entirely applicable.
